markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lattice Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=54)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [War of Immortals](/Sources.aspx?ID=232) pg. 146, [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 10 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 gp

**AC Bonus** +4

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -2

**Speed Penalty** -5 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** +3

**Bulk** 2

**Category** Medium

**Group** Chain
</row>

</column>

---

Also known as “varman” in some parts of the Impossible Lands, this armor is made from fine metal cables woven into latticework patterns with plated segments to protect the head, neck, and shoulders. This armor disperses blows much like rings of chain mail but is much tighter in construction, making it quieter.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-1" />
name: Lattice Armor
